meanings.definition: The woody, conical fruit of a pine tree.
meanings.sent1: I collected a pinecone during my nature walk.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel nibbled on the pinecone in the park.
meanings.sent3: The pinecone rolled down the hill and surprised a chipmunk.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts clustered together like a pinecone, forming a dense pattern.
meanings.sent5: The pinecone's intricate design fascinated the young children.

meanings.definition: To resemble or be shaped like a pinecone.
meanings.sent1: The new sculpture will pinecone the top of the building.
meanings.sent2: The pine trees in the forest pinecone beautifully in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cake batter started to pinecone as it was poured into the pan.
meanings.sent4: Her hair was styled to pinecone, mimicking the natural shape of the forest fruit.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush strokes pineconed the canvas with precision and grace.
